item.title: Prelim: Stochastic dominance
item.description: Stochastic dominance is a partial order on random variables. Let \(\ALPHABET X\) be a totally ordered finite set, say \(\{1, \dots, n\}\) and let \(\Delta(\ALPHABET X)\) denote the state of pmfs on \(\ALPHABET X\). Definition Suppose \(X\) and \(Y\) are \(\ALPHABET X\) valued random variables where \(X \sim \pi\) and \(Y \sim \mu\). We say \(X\) stochastically dominates \(Y\) if for any \(x \in \ALPHABET X\), \[\begin{equation}\label{eq:inc-prob} \PR(X \ge x) \ge \PR(Y \ge x).
